Chicago STD Testing: Test Today

Chicago STD Testing is a convenient and private alternative to testing with a primary care physician. Test as early as today for the eight common STDs in one quick visit. Appointments are never necessary and there are no long waits; a Chicago STD test takes about 15 minutes to be completed.

Testing is performed at dozens of private FDA-approved labs across the city. STD screening in Chicago uses simple, non-invasive urine and blood samples, so you can skip the physical exam and painful swabbing. Chicago STD Testing results are ready within 1 to 5 days.

Chicago Testing: About Us

With over 15 years of diagnostic experience, you can test with confidence with STD Testing Chicago.

A check for STDs in Chicago uses the most accurate tests available and is performed at private, FDA-approved labs. These labs go beyond STD testing and HIV testing in Chicago; they offer a variety of diagnostic services, so no one will know you are screening for STDs.

Your confidentiality is maintained and protected at every stage when STD testing in Chicago, from ordering to results.

Chicago STD Facts

According to the CDC, the following cases of STDs were reported in the Chicago metro area.Â These numbers reflect the cases that were diagnosed, so they are likely lower than the actual infections present. All STDs and HIV can occur without symptoms, so many cases go undiagnosed. STD testing is recommended once a year, with or without symptoms, or if there has been a possible exposure.

  • Chlamydia: 49,590 cases
  • Gonorrhea: 13,188 cases
  • Syphilis: 2,266 cases

Compared to U.S. as a whole, Chicago STD rates and statistics are higher than average. All STD rates, provided by the CDC, are based on rates per 100,000 persons.

  • Chlamydia rate: 524.1. The national average is 486.5.
  • Gonorrhea rate: 139.4. The national average is 117.9.
  • Syphilis rate: 24.0. The national average is 21.1.

HIV Testing in Chicago

Since its discovery in 1981, HIV and AIDS continue to impact those in Chicago. As of 2009 in Chicago:

  • 20,676 people were living with HIV/AIDS. Among those, 10,799 Chicagoans were living with AIDS and 9,872 were living with HIV.
  • 342 new AIDS cases and 832 new HIV cases were reported.
  • 59% of Chicagoans living with HIV/AIDS were African American, 23% were Caucasian and 16% were Latino.
  • 4 out of 5 new HIV diagnoses were among men. 87% of HIV men diagnosed reported sex with men as their likely mode of transmission.
  • 80% of women diagnosed with HIV are African American.

STD Testing Chicago offers HIV testing in Chicago at all lab locations. HIV testing is recommended once a year for all sexually active adults. The ELISA HIV test provides 99.9% accurate results 3 to 6 months after exposure. Results are available 1 to 5 business days after testing.

Finding Chicago STD Testing Locations

To accommodate your busy, urban lifestyle, HIV and STD testing in Chicago is located across the city. Options include: Lakeview, Boystown, the Loop, Rogers Park, River North, Chatham, Streeterville and more.

Testing in the Chicago suburbs is just as easy and readily available. Confidential, walk-in STD testing is available in all surrounding suburb areas including Elmhurst, Hinsdale, Arlington Heights, Evanston, Naperville, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Oak Park and more. Locations are also available in nearby northwest Indiana.

Healthcare Resources in Chicago

Chicago and Cook County have a wide range of healthcare resources. Chicago is home to Northwestern Memorial Hospital, the primary teaching hospital for Northwestern University, which was ranked as the best hospital in Chicago in 2010, according to U.S. News and World Reports. Chicago hosts dozens of additional hospitals throughout the city, as well as general practitioner care, county health departments, urgent care clinics, childrenâs specialties, veteran affairs and more.

Chicago STD Treatment

A positive test result can be surprising and confusing, but with STD Testing Chicago, caring and knowledgeable STD counselors available to answer any questions about your diagnosis. In-house physicians can also prescribe medication for positive chlamydia, gonorrhea or trichomoniasis. With proper medication, these curable STDs will resolve within 7 to 10 days. A prescription for genital herpes and oral herpes is also available for positive diagnoses.

Free STD Testing in Chicago

Free STD testing in Chicago is a desired option for many. However, free STD testing can be difficult to find in Chicago and beyond. In Chicago, Cook County Department of Public Health offers STD screening on a sliding fee scale, which means testing cost is based on one’s income and involves payment. Also, when free STD testing is available, it likely only includes reportable STDs–chlamydia, gonorrhea, HIV–and excludes other STDs like herpes, hepatitis and even syphilis.

Testing at health departments also require long wait times for both testing and results. Premium STD testing in Chicago offers a wide range of STD tests at an affordable costs with no extended wait times and fast results turnaround.
